file.content:
{
  "name": "claude-for-beginners-desktop",
  "version": "0.1.0",
  "private": true,
  "description": "Claude for Beginners — Desktop App",
  "main": "electron/main.js",
  "scripts": {
    "dev": "concurrently --kill-others \"next dev --port 3456\" \"wait-on http://localhost:3456 && electron .\"",
    "dev:web": "next dev --port 3456",
    "build": "next build",
    "package": "npm run build && electron-builder --config electron-builder.yml",
    "package:all": "npm run build && electron-builder --config electron-builder.yml --mac --win --linux",
    "test": "vitest run",
    "test:watch": "vitest",
    "test:coverage": "vitest run --coverage",
    "test:web": "vitest run --project web",
    "test:electron": "vitest run --project electron",
    "test:e2e": "playwright test",
    "test:ci": "vitest run --coverage && playwright test",
    "lint": "eslint",
    "logs": "tail -f ~/.claude-for-beginners/logs/*.log",
    "debug:status": "echo '=== Log files ===' && ls -lh ~/.claude-for-beginners/logs/ 2>/dev/null || echo 'No logs yet'"
  },
  "dependencies": {
    "@anthropic-ai/claude-agent-sdk": "^0.1.0",
    "@types/canvas-confetti": "^1.9.0",
    "canvas-confetti": "^1.9.4",
    "class-variance-authority": "^0.7.1",
    "clsx": "^2.1.1",
    "dugite": "^2.7.1",
    "electron-log": "^5.4.3",
    "electron-store": "^10.0.0",
    "framer-motion": "^12.34.0",
    "lucide-react": "^0.564.0",
    "next": "16.1.6",
    "next-intl": "^4.8.2",
    "radix-ui": "^1.4.3",
    "react": "19.2.3",
    "react-dom": "19.2.3",
    "react-markdown": "^10.1.0",
    "remark-gfm": "^4.0.1",
    "tailwind-merge": "^3.4.1",
    "zustand": "^5.0.0"
  },
  "devDependencies": {
    "@playwright/test": "^1.58.2",
    "@tailwindcss/postcss": "^4",
    "@testing-library/jest-dom": "^6.9.1",
    "@testing-library/react": "^16.3.2",
    "@testing-library/user-event": "^14.6.1",
    "@types/node": "^20",
    "@types/react": "^19",
    "@types/react-dom": "^19",
    "@vitest/coverage-v8": "^4.0.18",
    "concurrently": "^9.1.0",
    "electron": "^40.0.0",
    "electron-builder": "^26.0.0",
    "eslint": "^9",
    "eslint-config-next": "16.1.6",
    "jsdom": "^28.1.0",
    "shadcn": "^3.8.4",
    "tailwindcss": "^4",
    "ts-node": "^10.9.2",
    "tw-animate-css": "^1.4.0",
    "typescript": "^5",
    "vitest": "^4.0.18",
    "wait-on": "^8.0.0"
  }
}

file.content:
appId: dev.the-shift.claude-for-beginners
productName: Claude for Beginners
directories:
  output: build
  buildResources: resources
files:
  - electron/**/*
  - .next/standalone/**/*
  - .next/static/**/*
  - public/**/*
  - messages/**/*
  - "!node_modules"
extraResources:
  - from: resources/node/
    to: node/
  - from: resources/git/
    to: git/
  - from: "../skills/cc4d"
    to: cc4d-skill
mac:
  category: public.app-category.developer-tools
  target:
    - target: dmg
      arch:
        - arm64
        - x64
  icon: public/icon.icns
  hardenedRuntime: true
  gatekeeperAssess: false
dmg:
  backgroundColor: "#FFD700"
  iconSize: 128
  contents:
    - x: 380
      y: 170
      type: link
      path: /Applications
    - x: 130
      y: 170
win:
  target:
    - target: nsis
      arch:
        - x64
  icon: public/icon.ico
nsis:
  oneClick: false
  perMachine: false
  allowToChangeInstallationDirectory: true
linux:
  target:
    - AppImage
  category: Development
  icon: public/icon.png
publish:
  provider: github
  releaseType: release

content.thinking: The mascot is a cartoon character with glasses and a beard waving. Let me see a few more to understand the mascot options, and also check if there are currently any icon files in `public/`.

content.text: Let me see the other mascot options and check for existing icon files.

content.content: No files found

content.thinking:
The mascot is a cartoon bearded guy with glasses. The "waving" one is the friendliest, the "peeking" one behind a laptop is cute for a desktop app. Let me also check the "magic" one.

The electron-builder.yml references:
- `public/icon.icns` (mac)
- `public/icon.ico` (win)
- `public/icon.png` (linux)

But none of these files exist yet! So the app is currently using Electron's default icon.

To change the app icon, I need to:
1. Generate icon files from one of the mascot images


2. Create the platform-specific formats and add an `icon` property to the BrowserWindow on non-macOS platforms

I should probably ask the user which mascot they prefer before I start generating the icon files.

content.text:
I can see the mascot - a cartoon bearded guy with glasses. The `electron-builder.yml` already references `public/icon.icns`, `public/icon.ico`, and `public/icon.png`, but none of these files exist yet, so the app is using Electron's default icon.

Which mascot pose would you like for the app icon?

questions.question: Which mascot pose should we use for the app icon?

options.label: Waving
options.description: Friendly mascot waving hello - great for a welcoming app icon

options.label: Peeking (laptop)
options.description: Mascot peeking over a laptop - fits the desktop app context nicely

options.label: Magic
options.description: Let me check this one too

content.thinking:
The user chose the "hero" pose. Now I need to:

1. Generate the icon files from the hero.png mascot image
2. For macOS: Create an `.icns` file using `iconutil` (needs an `.iconset` folder with multiple PNG sizes)
3. For Windows: Create an `.ico` file 
4. For Linux: Just use a 512x512 or 1024x1024 PNG

Let me first check the dimensions of the hero.png source image.

content.text: Hero pose it is. Let me generate the icon files from it.

  pixelWidth: 1024
  pixelHeight: 1024

content.text: 1024x1024 - perfect source size. Let me generate all the icon formats.

input.command: cd /Users/tombensim/code/the-shift/claude-for-dummies/desktop && mkdir -p /tmp/icon.iconset && SRC=public/mascot/hero.png && sips -z 16 16 "$SRC" --out /tmp/icon.iconset/icon_16x16.png && sips -z 32 32 "$SRC" --out /tmp/icon.iconset/icon_16x16@2x.png && sips -z 32 32 "$SRC" --out /tmp/icon.iconset/icon_32x32.png && sips -z 64 64 "$SRC" --out /tmp/icon.iconset/icon_32x32@2x.png && sips -z 128 128 "$SRC" --out /tmp/icon.iconset/icon_128x128.png && sips -z 256 256 "$SRC" --out /tmp/icon.iconset/icon_128x128@2x.png && sips -z 256 256 "$SRC" --out /tmp/icon.iconset/icon_256x256.png && sips -z 512 512 "$SRC" --out /tmp/icon.iconset/icon_256x256@2x.png && sips -z 512 512 "$SRC" --out /tmp/icon.iconset/icon_512x512.png && sips -z 1024 1024 "$SRC" --out /tmp/icon.iconset/icon_512x512@2x.png && iconutil -c icns /tmp/icon.iconset -o public/icon.icns && echo "icns created"

I can use `sips` to create PNGs at the right sizes and then use `png2icns` or a Node script to create the .ico. Actually, let me try using a simple Node script to create the .ico from the PNG, or check if there's a python PIL available.

content.text: Now let me also add the `icon` property to the BrowserWindow for Linux/Windows (macOS uses the `.icns` from electron-builder).

input.old_string:
mainWindow = new BrowserWindow({
    width: 1280,
    height: 860,
    minWidth: 900,

content.text:
All three icon files are generated and valid. Here's what I did:

1. **`public/icon.icns`** (1.5 MB) - macOS app icon, generated from hero mascot at all required sizes (16px to 1024px with @2x variants)
2. **`public/icon.ico`** (56 KB) - Windows app icon with 16, 32, 48, and 256px sizes embedded
3. **`public/icon.png`** (988 KB) - Linux app icon (1024x1024)
4. **`electron/main.js`** - Added `icon` property to `BrowserWindow` so the taskbar/dock uses the mascot on Linux/Windows

The `electron-builder.yml` was already configured to use these paths, so packaged builds will pick them up automatically. Next time you run the app (`npm run dev`), the hero mascot will show as the app icon instead of Electron's default.
